title: Is The Anti-Oil Movement Installing The Next Recession?
text: From politicians to environmental groups to some on Wall Street demanding ESG at all costs, it seems everywhere we turn we are being told that new investment in oil and natural gas is simply not needed. Reality check: nothing could be further from the truth.

title: Stocks: There's room for earnings to improve... but the labor market is a risk near term: Strategist
text: This segment originally aired on February 12, 2021. Yahoo Finance's Adam Shapiro and Seana Smith spoke with U.S. Bank Wealth Management Sr. Investment Strategist, Rob Haworth about the outlook for stocks, jobs, and the economy in 2021.

title: The Markets Remain Firmly Bullish (Technically Speaking For The Week Of 2/8-2/12)
text: The labor market is still very soft. The indexes performed well last week.

title: Struggling With The Pandemic And Brexit In The U.K.
text: The UK did not manage the pandemic well last year, with the result that the UK has had more COVID deaths than any other European country and the highest death rate, 164.2 per 100,000 people. The new virus strain and the strict third national lockdown have clearly reduced the momentum of the UK economy.

title: An Outstanding Performance: Q4 Earnings Season Shattering Expectations
text: Powell signals Fed to remain in accommodative stance. Surpassing expectations, and then some: Impressive Q4 earnings to-date.

title: The Human Ups And Downs Of Market Mania
text: In the midst of manic market cycles, it is very human for one to imagine in retrospect where one "could have bought" and "should have sold." In reality, speculation is much more complicated, attention diverting, peace-destructive, and financially dangerous for individuals than commonly understood.

title: Weakening Economic Expectations Pull Down Consumer Sentiment
text: The preliminary February results from the University of Michigan Surveys of Consumers show overall consumer sentiment fell in early February and remains well below pre-lockdown levels. Overall consumer sentiment decreased to 76.2 in early February.

title: Week Ahead - Cause For Optimism
text: Investors are growing increasingly hopeful about the economic outlook and next week's PMIs will tell us whether businesses share their optimism. Central bank minutes will also provide more insight into whether policy makers are encouraged and what it means for monetary policy.

title: Dow Jones, S&P 500, and Nasdaq closed at record highs. Here are the next targets
text: The U.S. stock market advanced last week as investors remain optimistic about the large U.S. stimulus package. The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq set record closing highs on Friday while the Dow Jones did earlier in the week.

title: 5 Closed-End Fund Buys To Get The Income Snowball Rolling For 2021
text: Markets remained quite lofty, though later in January we got some volatility to spice things up. Overall, still holding a considerable cash position to take advantage of any market correction when it comes.

title: Roku, Walmart, Palantir, and Other Stocks to Watch This Week
text: The market is closed on Monday. Then, earnings season continues with results from Walmart, Occidental, Palantir, Roku, CVS, Shopify, Newmont, and many more.

title: S&P 500 Nears Inflection Point as Volatility Stirs
text: The markets should peak soon. I am eyeing February 18-19, as the S&P 500 Index and NASDAQ Composite still could push a bit higher to satisfy daily Demark counts.

title: Why one big Wall Street banker is betting flying taxis will replace helicopters
text: Electric aircraft maker Archer Air has a deal with United Airlines and plans to be flying by 2024. Wall Street's Ken Moelis says it can replace helicopters.

title: Want solid returns you can depend on? Here are stocks we love
text: People are obsessed lately with trying to find a way to get rich quick through short-term trades. Just look at bitcoin, GameStop or cannabis stocks.

title: 'We don't see a clear exit strategy'
text: When the coronavirus pandemic erupted in earlyÂ 2020, the ensuing border closures and stay-at-home orders brought travel and tourism to its knees. One year on, governments are using the same playbook, inflicting more pain on a sector that accounts for 10% of global GDP and a similar share of jobs.

title: Managing Risk: How To Rebalance Your Portfolio
text: A common mistake for investors to make is to bet too much of their portfolio on a handful of stocks. Diversification is essential to protecting your hard-earned money.

title: Why Dividend Cuts Can Be A Good Thing For Investors
text: Dividends offer several benefits to companies and shareholders, and dividend-paying companies tend to outperform. However, sometimes a dividend cut can be a wise decision that increases a company's value.

title: Dividend Increases: January 30-February 5, 2021
text: This weekly article series provides a summary of dividend changes. A table with relevant data and key statistics of dividend increases is provided.

title: The record-setting stock market has further upside ahead with depressed consumer confidence spring-loaded for a recovery, says a Wall Street chief strategist
text: The stock market's next leg up will have more to do with Main Street optimism than Wall Street bullishness, according to James Paulsen, the chief investment strategist at The Leuthold Group. Stocks wavered near all-time highs to close out the week as investors weighed stretched valuations against hopes for economic recovery. The surge to fresh records has led some to grow increasingly worried that a market correction will come later in the year as investor bullishness reaches a fever pitch.

title: Wall Street's fear index is on the verge of closing below a key level that signals more upside ahead for the stock market, Fundstrat says
text: There's more upside ahead for the stock market if Wall Street's fear index continues its decline below a key level, Fundstrat's Tom Lee said in a note on Friday. TheÂ CBOE Volatility index, known as the VIX, helps gauge the level of fear among investors and recently traded at 20.55 Friday afternoon. If the index manages to fall below the 20 level, it would be a bullish signal for stocks, according to Lee.

title: Monthly Review Of DivGro: January 2021
text: My monthly review of DivGro provides a summary of transactions and explains how those transactions affect projected annual dividend income. DivGro is my portfolio of dividend growth stocks. In January, I didn't add to or open any positions. However, I reduced the size of one existing position and closed another position. DivGro now contains 89 different positions.

title: Diamonds Are Forever, and So Are These 500 Stocks
text: These stocks are the investment of a lifetime.

title: Week 7 MDA Breakout Stocks - February 2021: Short-Term Picks To Give You An Edge
text: Two new breakout stocks for Week 7 of 2021 with better than 10% short-term upside potential. This past week all 4 picks gained over 10% with peak average gains of +17.4% before pulling back midweek to close with +13.7% one week returns.

title: Weekly Commentary: The Short But Momentous History Of Fed QE
text: Central banking traditionally operated as a judicious and conservative institution, with an overarching mandate focused on promoting monetary and financial stability. The world is now in the throes of history's greatest experiment in central bank doctrine and operations.

title: Speculative Mania Continues As It 'Goes Up In Smoke'
text: With the money flow signals still positive, the overall bias to the market remains bullish for now. However, the rally is still at risk currently, given the more extreme overbought and bullish conditions.

title: These Top Stocks Have A History Of Beating Earnings Estimates
text: Presented are the top-ranked stocks in our research that have beat analyst earnings estimates in each of the past four quarters. High-scoring stocks with a track record of beating on earnings can provide a great hunting ground for new stock ideas.

title: The Algebra Of Wealth
text: This post is about how to rebel against the algebra of wealth, orâ¦ how to get rich. It's not your income, but your income-to-expense ratio, that determines if you're rich.

title: Weighing The Week Ahead: A Letter From Mr. Market
text: We face a big economic calendar and only four days for data digestion. Market participants will not be troubled, since they have shown little appetite for economic data.

title: Bull-Bear Spread Spiking
text: Sentiment has understandably followed price action. The percentage of investors reporting as bullish in the AAII's weekly survey has risen to 45.5% from 37.4% this week.
